chatroom-pollEnrich example

1) Description

Chatroom-pollEnrich is a command line chat application that allows users to exchange messages. It also demonstrates how a Camel route can be configured with a pollEnrich pattern, polling samples from a DDS endpoint, and enriching the Camel message with poll results.

2) Scenario

There are 2 topics:

  • Chat_NameService topic: the topic type is a simple struct with userID and userName as attributes. When user logs in, he publishes a sample in this topic, and unregisters it when he logs out.
  • Chat_ChatMessage topic: the topic type is a struct userID, index of message and content of message. User publishes one sample on this topic for each sentence he enters.

The DDSChatDemo class defines 2 routes for incoming samples:

  • from Chat_NameService topic: a route to a processor displaying login/logout activity (checking DDS.SampleInfo.instance_state value from incoming sample's "DDS_SAMPLE_INFO" header, we know if the user login or logout).
  • from Chat_ChatMessage topic: a route to a pollEnricher which get the NameService sample with the same userID than in incoming ChatMessage sample, and uses an AggregationStrategy which create a new NamedMessage object combining all attributes from both samples. Then the NamedMessage object is displayed by a Processor.

NOTE: at this time Apache Camel doesn't implement a pollEnricher allowing to dynamically get poll options from incoming message headers (see CAMEL-2019). Thus, we provide a new DynamicPollEnricher implementation that has to be used instead. See usage in example code.

3) Design

It consists of 1 unit :

  • DDSChatDemo : a class that creates a chat user (chatter),sends a message to a DDS component ( which publishes it to other users ) and receives messges from other users through a Camel route (from DDS)

4) Building/Running

Environment Setup

  • Make sure to have Maven executable (mvn) and Java executable in PATH.
  • Make sure to have Vortex OpenSplice environment set (on Linux sourcing Vortex OpenSplice's release.com file).

Building the example:

  • Change directory to examples/chatroom-pollEnrich and execute:
    • mvn package

WARNING

The topics types of this example are not the sames than other chatroom examples. Thus, you have to stop Vortex OpenSplice daemon before and after running this chatroom-pollEnrich example:

  • ospl stop

Running the Java example:

  • Start the Vortex OpenSplice services:
    • ospl start
  • Open a command prompt and change directory to examples/chatroom-pollEnrich. Enter the following command:
    • mvn exec:java -Dexec.args="1 user1"
  • Open another command prompt in examples/chatroom-pollEnrich directory and enter the following command:
    • mvn exec:java -Dexec.args="2 user2"
  • Type a message on one of the terminals and hit ENTER. The message will appear on the other terminal.

Exiting the demo

  • Type 'quit' and hit ENTER.
